page.title: 07A YEAR ON NEW MANOR FARM
page.content: {AUTUMN}FIRST THEY PLOUGH THE FIELDS THEY USE A HARROW TO BREAK UP THE LUMPS OF EARTH.THE DRILL PUTS SEEDS IN THE GROUND.THE HARROW HELPS COVER THE SEEDS.NEXT THEY ROLL THE GROUND.THEY SPRAY AND FERTILISE THE FIELD WHEN NEEDED. {WINTER}IN WINTER THEY PLANT SPRING WHEAT, DUREM WHEAT AND SPRING BARLEY.THEY PLANT THE SEEDS IN THE SAME PROCESS AS IN AUTUMN.THE SEEDS START TO GROW THAT WERE PLANTED IN AUTUMN. {SPRING-SUMMER}LAMBING TAKES THREE OR FOUR WEEKS FOR MOST OF THE LAMBS TO BE BORN. THEN THE EWES ARE SHORN. COMBINING STARTS NOW AND IS VERY SLOW. THE BALES ARE TAKEN AWAY BY CONTRACTORS.
